page.title: 19POLITICAL LIFE
page.content: The parishes of Hammerwich and Burnt- ood,which is one of the most populous in the country,lie in the Lichfield District of Staffordshire County. Burntwood has its own Town Council and Hammerwich a parish council. The councillors have their meetings about once a month at schools or institutes and can claim expenses. The parish councils take care of local amenities including parks and the leisure centre,help local volantary organisations,comment on planning applications and deal with local problems such as transport,highways, building and housing. Burntwood's Town Manager ensures the council acts legally and efficiently in spending its 300,000 pounds per annum grant from the government of which 100, 000 pounds is spent on the Recreation centre.
